articles.author: Kevin Shalvey
articles.title: NASA says its Hubble telescope captured a spiral galaxy that’s as bright as a jewel and 68 million light-years from Earth - Business Insider Australia
articles.description: The European and US space agencies said a photo snapped by the Hubble was of a galaxy in the Fornax constellation, about 68 million light-years away.
articles.content:
The Hubble Space Telescope captured an image of a "jewel-bright" spiral galaxy, which is 68 million light-years from Earth. 
NASA and the European Space Agency published the photo. NASA said in a Fr… [+1018 chars]

articles.title: Australian scientists discover over 400-year-old coral reef in Queensland - Republic World
articles.description: The scientists said that the coral reef is about 421-438 years old, which means it is older than the European expedition and the foundation of Australia.
